results.title: Australian tourism [advertisement]
results.brief_description: Developed by Mojo MDA for the Australian Tourism Commission this advertisement was part of the ‘come and say g’day’ campaign and features Paul Hogan in a range of locations across Australia. It also uses a range of Australian slang expressions including a play on the famous expression ‘put another prawn on the barbie’.

results.title: Poison
results.brief_description: This drama, the first ever to come out of the ABC’s ‘Blackout’ series, considers three major aspects of Aboriginal reality - assimilation, adoption and sexual abuse, and how these circumstances have prompted the addictive personalities. It is the ugly, yet surprisingly beautiful, story of four troubled young people living together in a city squat. Although this film is about Aboriginal people, it is essentially about people in general - their anguish, their pain and their need to be loved and accepted. The story takes place within 24 hours and begins with languid preparations for a night on the town. Raylene (Lydia Miller), Wayne (Russell Page), Laniece (Rhoda Roberts) and Sharon (Lillian Crombie) stumble their way through a sleazy round of nightspots, becoming increasingly stoned and disoriented. While clinging to the fragile security they provide for each other, each is lost in his or her own private world, trying to contend with a past that keeps rearing its ugly head. ‘Poison’ is a telling tale about the difficulties experienced by so many Aboriginal people in coming to terms with themselves, their past and a society that has wronged them and demonstrates their struggle to cope with life under the cloud.

results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit

video_links.name: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action

results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.

results.title: Et cetera. Episode 3 [1999 Melbourne Fringe Festival]
results.creator_credit: David McLauchlan, Michael Costello and Northern Access TV
results.brief_description:
Documents the 1999 Melbourne Fringe Festival Parade and the Fringe Furniture Exhibition, including interviews with Virginia Hyam, Fringe Director, and Axel, Fringe Furniture Co-ordinator. The Melbourne Fringe Festival has become an institution since its inception in 1982 when a small group of independent artists gathered together to create a platform to present new and independent art to the community. From those early beginnings the Melbourne-based festival now attracts interstate and international guests and covers a wide variety of arts
performances including outdoor events such as the Annual Parade in Brunswick Street, Fitzroy, the Annual Waiter’s Race, street-theatre and live bands and indoor events including comedy and cabaret, music and theatre. The Fringe Furniture Exhibition allows for young students
and designers an opportunity to show-off their creative ability and caters for non-mainstream pieces. Crazy, outrageous, quirky and even occasionally practical, the Exhibition contains an amazing selection of eclectic pieces as witnessed in this documentary program.
Reporters: Melissa Iaria and Phillip Taylor.

Produced by Campaign Palace.

results.title: Green Fingers: Weed Control
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Weed Control’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to control weeds in the home garden. Cantrill shows a range of methods for managing weeds, including hoeing, mulching and herbicides, accompanied by a narrator who explains the benefits and correct techniques of each method. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Jack Creswick and Australian Ski Patrol Association
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.
